result.execSummary:
The defendant Katisha D Davis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine/Surcharge to be paid at the the rate of $50.00 per month commencing 4/1/2016 or penalty of 5 days Huber with child care included for non-payment.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Katisha D Davis

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Katisha D Davis in court with attorney Clarice Rosa Perkins.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Perkins makes statements.  Defendant makes statements. 
The Court Orders the Following to count #1:
FINE: $379.00
DNA Surcharge: $200.00
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
 Total costs/fine/forfeiture:    to be paid at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing 4/1/2016.  Failure to pay; the Court orders the defendant to serve 5 days in Huber with child care included

ADDRESS INFO for Katisha D Davis
Current: 3917 N. 92nd St., Milwaukee, WI 53222 United States  (Effective: 02-08-2016)
Prior: 1952 W Vienna Ave, Milwaukee, WI 53206
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Katisha D Davis in court with attorney Clarice Rosa Perkins.  David Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1. State needs to follow through with victim notification.  Court schedules the sentencing hearing.  

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 10:30 am.
copy of letter to the defendant by the Wisconsin State Public Defender.

Defendant Katisha D Davis in court.   David Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant qualifies for a public defender.  Court adjourns this matter.  Hearing scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant not to shop at any retail stores with co-actor. No contact with any Kohl's stores. Comply with ID processing

Defendant Katisha D Davis in court.  Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
